Happy Day #2 of National Poetry Month.

Keely Malone is a genderqueer, trauma-surviving, poet and parent, utilizing a myriad of modalities to unlock folks‚Äô potential. Combining nearly 20 years of conflict resolution/mediation, a lifetime of psychic mediumship and over a decade of hands-on healing, Malone guides people to address the foundational, underlying conflicts holding them back.

In this video clip, they pair their own poetry with images they have edited together to create a beautiful video, which serves to remind us that even with our most ordinary act of kindness and/or generosity to others, or to ourselves, especially in these difficult times, we are heroes.

Earn your Adult Diploma at night. This program is focused on supporting students who did not finish high school, are immigrants new to the U.S., or students who have dropped out. This program provides the opportunity to earn your diploma while offering the opportunity to link your personalized program of study with Vocational Prep/Certification Programs at night through elective credit. Students will complete their requirements through blended classroom instruction and online self-paced courses.

Career and College Counseling services are embedded in the program. This is not intended as an alternative High School pathway for High School aged students who are making progress through the traditional day model. Students must be at least 17 years old to register.

Earn your Adult Diploma and complete a pathway to a career at night at Smith Vocational. For more information contact Lorena Turner, Adult Education Director. lturner@smithtec.org
